net.sf.mmm.util.xml.impl.stax

Class XIncludeStreamReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.xml.stream.util.StreamReaderDelegate
      • net.sf.mmm.util.xml.base.StreamReaderProxy
        • net.sf.mmm.util.xml.impl.stax.XIncludeStreamReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XMLStreamConstants, XMLStreamReader

    public class XIncludeStreamReader
extends StreamReaderProxy
    This is an implementation of the XMLStreamReader interface that adapts an XMLStreamReader adding support for XInclude.
    For details about XInclude see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xinclude/.
    ATTENTION:
    Please note that currently only plain XML inclusion is currently supported and no XPointer.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • detectRecursiveInclusion

        protected void detectRecursiveInclusion(DataResource dataResource)
                                 throws XMLStreamException
        This method detects if a recursive inclusion takes place.
        TODO: Potentially the same resource could cause an inclusion cycle without causing an infinity loop by using different XPointer expressions.
        Parameters:
        dataResource - is the current data-resource to include.
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - if the given dataResource has already been included causing an infinity loop.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws XMLStreamException
        ATTENTION:
        This method violates the StAX API and closes the underlying input stream!
        The StAX API has a bad design mistake about the close() method NOT to close the underlying input stream. Besides the XMLStreamReader the user also has to manage the input stream what will lead in additional programming mistakes ending up with open file-handles. Since many XMLStreamReader implementations have an empty body for this method developers, may tend to take it NOT as serious as e.g. InputStream.close(). Since this implementation has to open new streams behind the scenes the only senseful implementation of this method is to close the underlying stream (and recursively closing all included streams). You have to ensure this reader is safely closed via this method so remaining open streams are closed.
        Specified by:
        close in interface XMLStreamReader
        Overrides:
        close in class StreamReaderDelegate
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException

      • resolveInclude

        protected int resolveInclude()
                      throws XMLStreamException
        This method is called when an include tag of the XInclude namespace was started. It resolves the include and finds a fallback on failure.
        Returns:
        the next event type.
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - if the XML stream processing caused an error.

      • closeInitialInclude

        protected void closeInitialInclude()
                            throws XMLStreamException
        This method ascends the XML until the initial include is closed.
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - if the XML stream processing caused an error.
